themes.scientific_basis: Based on Cultural Intelligence (CQ) theory and research on intercultural relationship dynamics
themes.description: Evaluates partners' ability to understand, respect, and navigate cultural differences, including values, traditions, and worldviews

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in Big Five personality research and studies on personality compatibility in relationships
themes.description: Assesses how couples understand and adapt to each other's personality traits, focusing on turning differences into complementary strengths

themes.scientific_basis: Based on Thomas-Kilmann Conflict Mode research and studies on conflict resolution styles
themes.description: Measures how effectively partners bridge different approaches to conflict, including their ability to adapt their conflict styles for better resolution

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from Chapman's Love Languages theory and research on expression of affection in relationships
themes.description: Examines how couples navigate differences in expressing and receiving love, including their ability to speak each other's preferred love languages

themes.scientific_basis: Based on psychological flexibility research and studies on adaptability in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates partners' ability to adjust their thinking and behavior patterns to accommodate differences, including openness to new perspectives

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in family systems theory and research on managing differences in family background
themes.description: Assesses how couples navigate differences in family background, upbringing, and social experiences to create their own unified approach

themes.scientific_basis: Based on values theory and research on managing value differences in relationships
themes.description: Measures how effectively couples identify, discuss, and reconcile differences in core values and beliefs while maintaining mutual respect

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from research on lifestyle compatibility and negotiation in relationships
themes.description: Examines how partners navigate differences in lifestyle preferences and daily habits, including their ability to find mutually satisfying solutions

themes.scientific_basis: Based on communication style research and studies on linguistic accommodation in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how couples adapt to and bridge different communication styles, including verbal and non-verbal expression patterns

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in positive psychology and research on relationship growth through challenge
themes.description: Assesses couples' ability to view differences as opportunities for growth and learning, measuring their capacity to transform challenges into strengths
